'Apply command to the global config file'
'If you want to choose a different composer.json or config.json'
'Returns absolute paths when fetching *-dir config values instead of relative'
'JSON decode the setting value, to be used with extra.* keys'
'Merge the setting value with the current value, to be used with extra.* keys in combination with --json'
'When adding a repository, append it (lowest priority) to the existing ones instead of prepending it (highest priority)'
'Display where the config value is loaded from'
This command allows you to edit composer config settings and repositories
in either the local composer.json file or the global config.json file.
Additionally it lets you edit most properties in the local composer.json.
To edit the global config.json file:
To remove a repository (repo is a short alias for repositories):
You can alter repositories in the global config.json file by passing in the
To add or edit suggested packages you can use:
To add or edit extra properties you can use:
Or to add a complex value you can use json with:
To edit the file in an external editor:
To choose your editor you can set the "EDITOR" env variable.
To get a list of configuration values in the file:
You can always pass more than one option. As an example, if you want to edit the
// Get the local composer.json, global config.json, or if the user
// passed in a file to use

'. Should be one of: auto, source, or dist'

' property can not be set in the global config.json file. Use `composer global config` to apply changes to the global composer.json'

'You can only pass one value. Example: php composer.phar config process-timeout 300'
